title.narrative: Interculturality, Food Sovereignty and National Agrarian Development Program

description.narrative: This project will be implemented by FENOCIN — a confederation of organizations that represent indigenous people — at the national level. This project will help FENOCIN continue with leadership training, expanding it at the regional and local level, and strengthen its structure by participating in the Organization’s Tenth National Congress. This will help the confederation advocate for the sovereignty of indigenous people to the government. FENOCIN must strengthen its human resources and continue actions targeting provincial bodies, to promote local development with identity and to have the possibility of bringing proposals to the Government’s attention. A second objective is to continue positioning food sovereignty and solidarity economics to influence formulation of the National Plan of Agrarian Development, to be discussed with the government. Finally, FENOCIN plans to structure a national program for legalization of land tenure. Initially, 1,680 families will participate, while a further 4,800 families will benefit from passing on the gift. The advocacy regarding the National Agrarian Development Plan (PNDA) will benefit the entire national agrarian population when it becomes national policy.
